subject: [PATCH v4 1/5] mm: introduce zone lock wrappers

reviews.author: Steven Rostedt
reviews.summary:
reviewer noted that the zone lock tracepoints do not handle the case where CONFIG_TRACING is disabled, and suggested adding a check for this condition to avoid unnecessary function calls

The reviewer questioned the use of a boolean 'success' parameter in __zone_lock_trace_acquire_returned(), suggesting that it should always be set to true and proposing a simplified version.
reviews.raw_body:
On Fri, 27 Feb 2026 16:00:27 +0000
Dmitry Ilvokhin <d@ilvokhin.com> wrote:

---

Why the "success" variable and not just:

	__zone_lock_trace_acquire_returned(zone, true);

 ?

2026-02-27.patch_summary: This patch adds tracepoint instrumentation to zone lock acquire and release operations in the Linux kernel. The implementation uses a lightweight inline helper to check if tracing is enabled, and calls an out-of-line helper when tracing is active. When CONFIG_TRACING is disabled, the helpers compile to empty inline stubs, leaving the fast path unaffected. This patch introduces three new tracepoints: zone_lock_start_locking, zone_lock_acquire_returned, and zone_lock_released.
